wikipedia_page.main: Thomas George "T. G." Jones (12 October 1917 – 3 January 2004) was a Welsh footballer most notable for his career with Everton and Wales.

response: * T. G. Jones (Thomas George Jones, 1917–2004), Welsh international football for Everton

Formed in July 1946 as Connah's Quay Juniors, the present-day club was the brainchild of the Everton and Wales centre-half T. G. Jones, a native of the town. Attracted by the reputation of the famous international, the Deeside youngsters flocked to join the new team which quickly became a major force in North Wales youth soccer, winning the Welsh Youth Cup in 1948.

Kelly was  also unable to persuade Tommy Lawton to stay and he attempted to sell T. G. Jones to A.S. Roma to raise £15,000, but exchange control prevented the transfer. Many players saw Kelly as a remote, autocratic and petty figure.  Dixie Dean said that the main reason for leaving Everton in 1937 was Theo Kelly.  Kelly distrusted players bought on the transfer market and so the playing resources were quickly depleted.
